text: Fatana Najib (born 1953) is an Afghan linguist and is former First Lady of Afghanistan. She served as First Lady from 30 September 1987 until 16 April 1992. She was the wife of Afghan President Mohammad Najibullah, who was murdered in 1996 by the Taliban. During her time as First Lady, Najib provided support to families of servicemembers of the Afghan Armed Forces, visiting the families of wounded soldiers. Najib and her three daughters fled Afghanistan in 1992 to live in exile in India. They have resided in India ever since. ==References== Category:1953 births Category:First Ladies of Afghanistan Category:Linguists from Afghanistan Category:Women linguists Category:Afghan expatriates in India Category:Living people
